feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows a discrepancy in daily wage formula calculation between leave policy and payroll settings. The payroll-side daily wage calculator takes precedence and overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave deductions. The greyed-out display in leave policy indicates an intentional override, causing user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required, with no automatic formula inheritance or synchronization.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in incorrect payroll deduction amount.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change. | Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions that might exceed monthly salary

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator does not correctly account for leap years, specifically 2024's 366 days. This results in an incorrect total service period calculation (607 days instead of 608 days) and a lower gratuity amount (AED 10,476.98 instead of AED 10,494.24).
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation shows slight differences from manual calculations, with complexity arising from service duration splits and tiered gratuity rates
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation involves complex rules: different rates for first 5 years (21 days per year) and subsequent years (30 days per year), with prorated calculations for incomplete years
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation logic requires precise handling of service duration splits and partial year prorations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), potentially causing minor discrepancies in service duration calculation. The specific issue involves whether the leap day should be counted in total service days when calculating gratuity.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled, causing potential minor calculation differences.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for clear documentation on how leap year days are precisely counted in service duration calculations.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Days Worked Calculation in Gratuity
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates days worked with a potential extra day (622 vs 623 days), causing slight variations in gratuity calculation. Daily wage is computed using a fixed divisor of 30 days, which may not align with all client expectations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked counting and fixed daily wage computation method
known_issues.gap_statement: Inflexible daily wage calculation that doesn't support alternative computation methods

known_issues.title: Discrepancy in Leave Salary Calculation Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on a fixed daily rate configuration in policy, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days. The calculation divides daily wage using a predefined divisor (potentially 30 days) that might not match actual calendar days in a month.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses a fixed policy-configured divisor that does not dynamically adjust to month length
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in explaining how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations

known_issues.title: Monthly Working Days Impact on Leave Salary Accrual
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary accrual calculations vary month-to-month due to different working day counts
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses different divisors for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days), causing calculation discrepancies. Leave salary and salary proration are configured independently, leading to potential mismatches in daily wage calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations use separate configurations with different divisors
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method across leave salary and salary proration scenarios

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated. The system calculates proration based on the specific work week configuration, where in this case, all 7 days were configured as working days for NVK Operations, resulting in a full 31-day working month calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not align with traditional weekend/workday expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to the payroll processing date. While proration works for past departure dates, it does not apply for future departure dates, causing full monthly salary to be displayed instead of a prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The daily wage calculator lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap exists in handling dynamic proration scenarios for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date.

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductionsâ€”one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Time Off and Payroll modules. The system cannot recalculate deductions retroactively, causing mismatched salary deduction amounts.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic recalculation when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for module communication enhancement to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in remarks for February unpaid leave calculations, despite the backend calculation being mathematically correct. This creates potential user confusion about daily rate calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual leave policy calculations for unpaid leave deductions. This means the calculation uses a system-wide setting instead of policy-specific methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically supersede policy-level unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month of leave.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display logic does not preserve the initially calculated rate from the leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need a consistent daily rate display mechanism that stores and shows the rate from the original leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Standard
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a 26 working days per month standard, calculated as 365 (annual days) - 52 (weekly offs) = 313 total working days / 12 months = 26.08 working days per month
limitations.impact: Requires manual adjustments for variations in employee attendance

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
limitations.limitation_statement: For unpaid leave, the daily wage calculator configured in payroll settings automatically overrides the formula in the leave policy. The leave policy formula is displayed as greyed out, indicating it will not be used for calculations.
limitations.impact: Users must configure daily wage calculations in payroll settings to ensure correct unpaid leave deductions

limitations.title: Salary Configuration Dependency in Deduction Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or simultaneously with leave request

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
limitations.limitation_statement: System defaults to 365 days for all years, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently produce amounts slightly lower than expected due to decimal precision handling.
limitations.impact: Affects accuracy of final settlements for employees leaving mid-month

limitations.title: Mid-Month Departure Leave Accrual Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Monthly accrual policy does not automatically include or prorate leave days for incomplete months, requiring manual intervention for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month may not have their current month's leave days automatically included in End of Service (EOS) calculations

limitations.title: Service Duration Day Counting Rules
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether the departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are incorporated into total service duration.
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity amount calculations

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic Salary / 30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of gratuity calculation methodology for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Inflexible Leave Salary Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations, which cannot easily be overridden for specific scenarios
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify daily wage divisor or calculation method per individual leave request

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Daily Wage Calculation Constraint
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage for leave encashment is calculated based on working days, which varies monthly
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary accruals will differ across months with different working day counts

limitations.title: Separate Leave and Proration Wage Calculation Methods
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations for leave salary and salary proration are configured separately and do not automatically align
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies between leave salary and salary proration

limitations.title: Salary Proration Tied to Work Week Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage proration is calculated strictly based on the configured work week, including cases where all 7 days are marked as working days
limitations.impact: Proration will reflect the exact work week setup, which may differ from standard calendar day calculations

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is only applied when the departure date is in the past, not when it is in the future relative to payroll processing.
limitations.impact: Potential overpayment or incorrect salary calculations for offboarded employees

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling in Leave Transactions
limitations.limitation_statement: The system does not automatically remove or reconcile payroll deductions when leave requests are modified, deleted, or have their status changed.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention to resolve.

limitations.title: Working Days Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts can vary based on public holiday configurations and timing of leave requests

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, which may not align with exact calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts can slightly differ from expected monthly salary calculations

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations are based on calendar days, with specific handling required for months with varying days (especially February in leap years).
limitations.impact: Requires precise daily rate calculation using the actual number of days in each month

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses different divisors for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days), causing calculation discrepancies. Leave salary and salary proration are configured independently, leading to potential mismatches in daily wage calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated. The system calculates proration based on the specific work week configuration, where in this case, all 7 days were configured as working days for NVK Operations, resulting in a full 31-day working month calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to the payroll processing date. While proration works for past departure dates, it does not apply for future departure dates, causing full monthly salary to be displayed instead of a prorated amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductionsâ€”one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Time Off and Payroll modules. The system cannot recalculate deductions retroactively, causing mismatched salary deduction amounts.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in remarks for February unpaid leave calculations, despite the backend calculation being mathematically correct. This creates potential user confusion about daily rate calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual leave policy calculations for unpaid leave deductions. This means the calculation uses a system-wide setting instead of policy-specific methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month of leave.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Standard
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is based on a 26 working days per month standard, calculated as 365 (annual days) - 52 (weekly offs) = 313 total working days / 12 months = 26.08 working days per month

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
claims_to_validate.statement: For unpaid leave, the daily wage calculator configured in payroll settings automatically overrides the formula in the leave policy. The leave policy formula is displayed as greyed out, indicating it will not be used for calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Configuration Dependency in Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
claims_to_validate.statement: System defaults to 365 days for all years, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently produce amounts slightly lower than expected due to decimal precision handling.

claims_to_validate.title: Mid-Month Departure Leave Accrual Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Monthly accrual policy does not automatically include or prorate leave days for incomplete months, requiring manual intervention for mid-month departures

claims_to_validate.title: Service Duration Day Counting Rules
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether the departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are incorporated into total service duration.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic Salary / 30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Leave Salary Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations, which cannot easily be overridden for specific scenarios

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Encashment Daily Wage Calculation Constraint
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage for leave encashment is calculated based on working days, which varies monthly

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Leave and Proration Wage Calculation Methods
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations for leave salary and salary proration are configured separately and do not automatically align

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Proration Tied to Work Week Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage proration is calculated strictly based on the configured work week, including cases where all 7 days are marked as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration is only applied when the departure date is in the past, not when it is in the future relative to payroll processing.

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling in Leave Transactions
claims_to_validate.statement: The system does not automatically remove or reconcile payroll deductions when leave requests are modified, deleted, or have their status changed.

claims_to_validate.title: Working Days Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, which may not align with exact calendar days

claims_to_validate.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations are based on calendar days, with specific handling required for months with varying days (especially February in leap years).
